metadata.synopsis: COM for Lae'zel at the Knights of the Shield hideout.
metadata.how_to_trigger: This will be triggered walking into the hideout with an avatar different to Lae'zel. She can be in the party or not, dialog handle both ways.

43.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
43.text: Here you are, as brazen as described.

39.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
39.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

30.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
30.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

74.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
74.text: Of course, you had help, didn't you? From the illithid you carry inside the Astral Prism.

18.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
18.text: How quaint that we should meet here - in the very place that it once called home.

11.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
11.text: We know all about the 'Emperor' and its dealings with you. Though I must confess its peculiar relationship with you threw us off course for a while.

81.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
81.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, only partially transformed.

24.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
24.text: Tell me - what did it offer you in exchange for your servitude?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: How did you know about that?

37.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
37.text: Have you quite forgotten what and who we are, kin?

12.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
12.text: Mind flayers are our quarry. We have filled libraries with our knowledge of how to hunt them down.

0.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
0.text: We tracked it from the moment the Astral Prism fell into its claws.

55.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
55.text: And now that we have found it, we will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to its rightful owner.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: You should know the Emperor is not the only occupant of the Astral Prism.

26.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
26.text: My dear child, I already know all there is to know.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'd give it to you freely, if the mind flayer would let me.

23.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
23.text: Ha! I see it keeps you on a tight leash. Very good.

54.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
54.text: I will liberate you from your puppet-master. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!
54.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith's will above all! shouted as combat rally

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I'd give it to you freely, if it were possible to do so.

46.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
46.text: I will remember you said that.

17.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
17.text: I was not asking for it. Htak'a!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I've fought stronger, faster, and more accomplished warriors than you. You cannot win.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'll send you home in your own box!

66.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
66.text: Death will be yours and yours alone, ghaik slave. Htak'a!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: The promise of defeating the elder brain.

78.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
78.text: And you would trust an illithid to do such a thing?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I serve one far greater than any illithid. We are merely allies.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: There's no servitude - the illithid is my ally.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: My people served the illithid once - never again. We are allies.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: My people answer to none but Gruumsh. We are merely allies.

41.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
41.text: I thought you said this one was smart, W'wargaz?
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargazNodeContext: sneering

50.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
50.text: You have fallen prey to its manipulation.

63.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
63.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to our queen.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I serve none other than the wild tempest that is nature. We are merely allies.

84.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
84.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, untransformed.

62.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
62.text: The traitor who would steal from our queen.

44.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
44.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

47.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
47.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

36.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
36.text: The kith'raki have spread word of that artefact that you carry.

9.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
9.text: Tell me, Lae'zel of K'liir. What reward do you think the Astral Prism will fetch once I pluck it from your corpse and present it to Vlaakith?

19.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
19.text: What honours, what riches, will the Undying Queen grant me when I hand her the failed prince?

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Stand down! It is on our queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

71.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
71.text: The Undying Queen cares not for who delivers her the Prism and the traitor prince within.

20.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
20.text: All that matters is that it is delivered.

53.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
53.text: The false heir's head will make a fine trophy for Vlaakith. As for you -

80.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
80.text: - I will leave nothing behind but meat and shattered bone.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Vlaakith entrusted Lae'zel with the Prism. Interfere, and the queen's sure to punish you.

76.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
76.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

72.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
72.text: You may keep your head. But I will yet be exalted. I will yet see my name carved in slate.

87.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
87.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

28.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
28.text: Damnable whelp. For a thousand years have I given my life to Vlaakith.

13.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
13.text: I will deliver to her the Prince of the Comet. She shall exalt me. The gish will record my great deed in slate!

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

51.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
51.text: Gith's wretched son will be the fall of the githyanki.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

83.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
83.text: I know exactly what the Prism contains. The traitor prince who would hand us to ghaik.

77.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
77.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.

75.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
75.text: I'm told you carry an artefact most cherished.
